722694f.text: Riverside Drive. Entrance at 72nd St. looking north. William J. McAlpin supervising engineer. Sept. 30, 1879. Deposited uith NYPL by NYC Park Dept. 1931.

722696f.text: Hudson River monument, Riverside Drive & 72d St. Designed by Allen G. Newman, Sc. Cast by Jno. Williams, Inc. 1909. Photographer: A. B. Sogart, 80 E. 14th St.

722695f.text: Riverside Drive and Park, north from West 72nd Street. The spacious home at the right is the Charles M. Schwab mansion. This occupies the entire block bounded by the Drive, West End Avenue, between 73rd and 74th Streets. Beyond, are the 12-story Lombard (erected 1907- 8), No. 332 West End Avenue and the massive Apthorpe Apartments (erected 1908), No. 2201-17 Broadway. Construction of the latter date this view. 1908. Gift of I. N. P. Stokes

722870f-b.text:
Riverside Park:

1. Riverside Drive, north from but not including 72nd Street, showing the Schwab Residence in the background. March 19, 1930. P. L. Sperr.

2. The overhead pedestrian crossing at the foot of West 72nd Street. March 19, 1930. P. L. Sperr.

Riverside Park:

1. Riverside Drive, north from but not including 72nd Street, showing the Schwab Residence in the background. March 19, 1930. P. L. Sperr.

722704f-a.text: Riverside Drive, south from 77th to and including 72nd Streets (Riverside Drive begins at 72nd Street). June 11, 1934. P. L. Sperr.
